meanings.definition: (verb) to cause a sharp, cutting pain
meanings.sent1: The sudden movement of the knife lancinated through his hand.
meanings.sent2: The scream pierced the air as the lancinating pain shot through her leg.
meanings.sent3: The lancinating pain in his back made him dance like a puppet on strings.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like lancinating daggers, cutting through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The lancinating sensation was so intense, it felt like lightning striking his body.

meanings.sent1: The lancinating sensation in her shoulder was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: His lancinating cry echoed through the silent night.
meanings.sent3: The lancinating toothache made him regret skipping the dentist.
meanings.sent4: The lancinating memories of the accident haunted her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The lancinating cold wind cut through their jackets like knives.
